meanings.definition: To express deep sorrow or grief for
meanings.sent1: She bewailed the loss of her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The villagers bewailed the destruction caused by the storm.
meanings.sent3: The puppy bewailed the absence of its owner with sad howls.
meanings.sent4: The old tree bewailed the passing of time through its creaking branches.
meanings.sent5: The widow bewailed her husband's departure with heart-wrenching cries.

meanings.sent1: He bewailed his failed attempt to fix the broken vase.
meanings.sent2: The poet bewailed the loss of nature's beauty in his verses.
meanings.sent3: The child bewailed the end of the fun day at the park.
meanings.sent4: The violin bewailed a haunting melody in the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The ghost bewailed its eternal loneliness in the abandoned house.
